title: Riven CC cancels discussion and ignorance (lack of knowledge of a specific bug)
body:
Hey guys i am Adrian Riven the person who discovered the cc cancel bug with Riven. i got linked to some of the posts that have been poping up lately on the boards and i have to say there is a lot of wrong information being spread about this bug and it mostly seems to be because people have no idea how it actually works.  

here's an example working on another champion

https://i.gyazo.com/b1a76814d6045567c5286e10af2ca03f.gif

First of all this bug is not something that is only exclusive to riven, It is just easier to accomplish on riven because of the fact that she can use 2 dashes at any given moment. Every single champion that has a dash can currently cc cancel displacements. And there are some dashes like poppy e that can currently cancel lee sin r completely by just input buffering her e once he gets in your range. (also if you didn't know, You can flash any type of displacement ability and it wont move you if timed correctly. Such as poppy Ultimate.)
So i'm going to basically correct some of the information that got spread here recently by uninformed players. 

1."She has a known, extremely game-changing bug that is relatively easy to do, and people are abusing it. "

False. Not even challenger riven players are able to abuse this bug reliably because it has to be frame perfect for it to work and its also so extremely situational that you would only use this 1 out of 300 games. Most of the time you would kill yourself for trying to accomplish this bug( not exaggerating) 

2."Riven is not just causing issues with displacement effects on dashing. This is not a hook/pull/knockback only issue. She is able to remove any and all forms of CC."

Again incorrect info. The only cc that can be canceled by the use of dashes is displacements and knockups with 2 parts of cc.(Again this dash bug can be replicated with every single champion with a dash. I REPEAT ITS NOT EXCLUSIVE TO RIVEN)

3." Ez still gets cc after his teleport.Riven totally remove any cc." 

Riven and any other champion that uses this bug will still be cced through it since you still see the cc bar on top of the champions.


TL'DR.  EVERY champion with a dash can do this bug Stop spreading false information because a riven rekt you. Sincerely a challenger player.


Posts i got linked 

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/LjX1bWNy-in-all-seriousness-why-isnt-riven-disabled

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/BZQBX3V0-for-the-love-of-god-fix-riven-already


Also if riot wants to know more information on how this bug works feel free to let them know to message me.

Circlejerking over champions like Riven and Lee are a past-time for people that frequent anything resembling a "balance" board who think they know more about balance or game design than they actually do, and they have been for years now. 

Most often when people starting complaining en masse about a champion they're not looking at the bigger picture of _why_ that champion appears to be a problem, they just start seeing the champion look problematic and automatically assume it's because they're a terribly designed, broken and toxic champion that needs gutted or reworked no matter what the actual reason for their strength is. It can't be because the meta right now is early-game-centric with a focus on snowballing that explains why champions like Lee and Vi are popular on a given patch, it has to be because they're ridiculous (notice that often Vi is a good pick whenever Lee is, for basically the same reasons). If the meta favors them then of course they're going to be popular, that's how the design of a MOBA will work - you can't blame the champion for being played to its strengths, that results in what happened to Sejuani during the Cinderhulk era where she gets nerfed, then what actually made her seem problematic (along with other champions) got nerfed, and then she was left to dry after her time in the cucking stool. You change the focus of the meta, you can change what champions will be popular without doing as much alteration to the champions themselves. 

Circlejerks (and thus the Gameplay boards) are where logic goes to die, buried in a sea of undeserved upvotes.

Is it a meme that Memes & Games board is actually a better place for balance discussions?
I frequent the Gameplay board a lot and i, most of the times, have to play the contrarian to these circlejerk threads. And i'm labeled as Riot's White Knight because of it, not because i might actually know that one thread about a problem does not equal to a problematic champion.

It's way too easy to shit on something than to logically look at it from various perspectives and try to find the reasoning on why they're strong in the first place, yourself. Because we all know that opening your mouth to complain en masse is the way to make Riot force a change, that we again come to complain about when it turns out not to be the best solution...

Looking at things from multiple perspectives is always more difficult than proclaiming something is wrong or broken and being done with it, because when you analyze something from multiple perspectives properly you have to take far more into account: champion design, champion balance, game design as a whole, game balance as a whole, current meta, current goals of Riot themselves, possible future goals, items, masteries, runes, synergies with allied champions, mechanics of the game engine itself, and so on. Sometimes a champion is mostly just strong because there's a few things in particular right now that favor them, but if they're being favored by those things then odds are very high that they're favoring other champions as well, which helps to shape the current meta, which means you would likely accomplish more by balancing those extraneous things than the champions that weren't considered problematic until those few things were bent into their favor. 

This happens in DotA2 as much as it happens in League, so I have plenty of experience with looking at things from multiple angles to try and draw a more reasonable conclusion.

That's the point.
People just don't want to admit they don't have all the facts, they try to push through their own opinions as solid facts and act like Riot should balance the game according their beliefs. Meanwhile, Riot pulls raw data for their champions and analyzes them from multiple angles and then decides what is the appropriate action to take.

Sometimes it may not turn out as expected but what annoys me the most is when players themselves shrug off "Riot has more data than you" argument like it's a blatant lie while their beliefs are regarded as facts.

From a year or so on the boards, i feel like it's a waste of my time trying to get through these blockheads. And it just pisses me off how ignorant they are. I don't regard myself as being right all the time but i am there to challenge their point of view and force them to consider a different one. If the balance of the game was up to them, we'd be up shit's creek in a single patch. And yet, they continue to believe they could make more improvements in a single patch than Riot has ever made in years - by only removing Yasuo, for example.
Because deleting a problem, makes it "fixed"...

Keep up the good fight then, because people will either learn the hard way or they'll continue on to spread the idea that narrow opinions are as valid as far-reaching facts. Sometimes it's not the champion that's the problem, it's what surrounds the champion. 

And that assumes they're actually problematic in the first place and it isn't just popularity being misconstrued as problematic.

> Info dump on this bug:

> We've got a fix for it that should be going out in the next patch (7.2), assuming it passes final testing.
That fix address an issue where Riven's E could be used to negate displacement CC and the associated stun (and not just in the intended 'dashes/displacements can override other dashes/displacements' way). Timing was much easier if used in combination with other abilities on her kit (buffering), but could be done with just the E.
We don't have a repro on any other displacement cancelling effects besides that one with the E. It's possible there's something else, none of the bug reports we've got had demonstrated other cases yet however.
Similarly we've seen reports the bug could be used to cancel non displacement CC, but haven't seen a demonstrated case of that occuring to investigate (if you've got a good repro would love to see it).
This bug's been live on Riven for at least a year (probably a lot longer). Given that, difficulty exploiting it reliably in game, lack of increase in average power after the bug began getting discussed, attempts to exploit the bug often leading to Rivens just wasting their abilities mid fight and dashes/displacements in general being able to override existing dashes/displacements we concluded this was not a disable worthy bug.
